description.value: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The dragon makes three Rend attacks.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. *Failure:* 38 (or [[7d10]] (7d10)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of the dragon's next turn. *Success:* Half damage only.

The dragon shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid or a Small or Medium Beast, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.
The adult deep dragon can take 3 legendary actions.
The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 15, one creature within 30 feet of the dragon that it can see. *Failure:* 13 (or [[3d8]] (3d8)) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. *Failure or Success:* The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.
If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) Time-Warping Breath or (B) Spellcasting to cast *Thunderwave*.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 18, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. *Failure:* 63 (or [[14d8]] (14d8)) Necrotic damage. *Success:* Half damage.

The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18): At Will: Detect Magic, Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), Thunderwave 1/Day: Legend Lore (as an action)

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 18, each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a 60-foot Cone. *Failure:* The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
The adult spirit dragon can take 3 legendary actions.
The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.
The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast *Thunderwave*.

The dragon magically raises broken, ancient ruins in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. Ground in the Cylinder becomes Difficult Terrain. Each creature in the Cylinder when it appears is subjected to the following effect. *Strength Saving Throw:* DC 18. *Failure:* 5 (or [[2d4]] (2d4)) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. *Failure or Success:* The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.
If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The dragon makes three Rend attacks.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 20, each creature in a 90-foot Cone. *Failure:* 44 (or [[8d10]] (8d10)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of the dragon's next turn. *Success:* Half damage only.

The dragon shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid or a Small or Medium Beast, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.
The ancient deep dragon can take 3 legendary actions.
The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 20, one creature within 30 feet of the dragon that it can see. *Failure:* 16 (or [[3d10]] (3d10)) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. *Failure or Success:* The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.
If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) Time-Warping Breath or (B) Spellcasting to cast *Thunderwave* (level 2 version).
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 22, each creature in a 90-foot Cone. *Failure:* 72 (or [[16d8]] (16d8)) Necrotic damage. *Success:* Half damage.

The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22): At Will: Detect Magic, Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), Thunderwave (level 2 version) 1/Day Each: Legend Lore (as an action), Sequester

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 22, each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a 90-foot Cone. *Failure:* The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
The ancient spirit dragon can take 3 legendary actions.
The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.
The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast *Thunderwave* (level 2 version).

The dragon magically raises broken, ancient ruins in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. Ground in the Cylinder becomes Difficult Terrain. Each creature in the Cylinder when it appears is subjected to the following effect. *Strength Saving Throw:* DC 22. *Failure:* 13 (or [[3d8]] (3d8)) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. *Failure or Success:* The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Spider Climb (Hybrid or Spider Form Only)

description.value: The aranea can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
The aranea ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and it knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.
The aranea makes two attacks, using Bite, Slam, or Sling in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The aranea casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At Will: Friends, Silent Image 1/Day: Hold Person

The aranea shape-shifts into a humanoid form, into a humanoid-spider hybrid form, or back into its true spider form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.
The beast breathes air and water.
If the beast dies, its body dissolves into black goo, and it gains a new body after [[1d10]] (1d10) days, reviving with all its Hit Points in a place of Malar's choosing.
If the beast fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The beast has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The beast regains 20 Hit Points at the start of its turn. If the beast takes Radiant damage or damage from a Critical Hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of the beast's next turn. The beast dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.
The beast makes three attacks, using Bite or Claws in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
If the target is Large or smaller, it has the Prone condition.

The beast shape-shifts into its land form, sea form, or sky form and regains 9 (or [[2d8]] (2d8)) Hit Points. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.
Biha Babir can breathe air and water.

If Biha Babir dies outside the Elemental Plane of Water, her body dissolves into brine, and she gains a new body in [[1d4]] (1d4) days, reviving with all her Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Water.
If Biha Babir fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

Biha Babir knows the *Wish* spell but can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way Biha Babir can understand. If Biha Babir casts the spell for a creature, she suffers none of the spell's stress. Once Biha Babir has cast it three times, she can't do so again for 365 days.
Biha Babir makes two Marine Burst attacks. She can replace one of these attacks with a Tail attack.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
If the target is Huge or smaller, it has the Prone condition.

Biha Babir casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At Will: Create or Destroy Water, Detect Magic, Major Image 2/Day Each: Control Water (Flood, Part Water, or Redirect Flow only), Dispel Magic, Invisibility 1/Day Each: Control Weather, Plane Shift
Biha Babir shape-shifts into a form resembling a Beast or Humanoid that is Medium or smaller, while retaining her game statistics (other than her size), or returns to her true marid form.
The biha babir can take 3 legendary actions.
Biha Babir teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of herself and makes one Marine Burst attack.

*Strength Saving Throw:* DC 18, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from Biha Babir. *Failure:* 10 (or [[3d6]] (3d6)) Force damage, and the target is pulled 15 feet straight toward Biha Babir. *Success:* Half damage only. *Failure or Success:* Biha Babir can't use this action again until the start of her next turn.
The cultist regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it is Bloodied and has at least 1 Hit Point.
The cultist makes three attacks, using Gauntlet or Oppressive Burst in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast *Dominate Person*, if available.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target can't take Reactions until the start of the cultist's next turn.
The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16): 2/Day Each: Calm Emotions, Detect Thoughts 1/Day: Dominate Person
*Trigger:* The cultist is hit by an attack roll. *Response:* The cultist makes one Gauntlet or Oppressive Burst attack against the triggering creature.
While Bloodied, the cultist has Advantage on saving throws.
The cultist makes three Cursed Blade attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting.
Attack has Advantage if the target doesn’t have all its Hit Points.
Attack has Advantage if the target doesn’t have all its Hit Points. *Hit or Miss:* The blade magically returns to the cultist's hand immediately after a ranged attack.
The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): 2/Day: Mind Spike 1/Day Each: Dimension Door, Mislead
While Bloodied, the cultist has Immunity to the Frightened and Poisoned conditions.
The cultist makes three Necrotic Burst attacks.
The target can't regain Hit Points until the end of the cultist's next turn.
The target can't regain Hit Points until the end of the cultist's next turn.
The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At Will: Speak with Dead, Thaumaturgy 1/Day Each: Animate Dead, Circle of Death

*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 20, each Bloodied creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the scion at the end of the scion's turn. *Failure:* The target can't regain Hit Points until the start of the scion's next turn.
If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The scion has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The scion makes two attacks, using Death Touch or Mindwrack Bolt in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the scion's next turn.

The scion casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20): At Will: Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic 2/Day Each: Dimension Door, Invisibility, Scrying 1/Day Each: Circle of Death, Create Undead
The dead three scion can take 3 legendary actions.
The scion makes a Death Touch or Mindwrack Bolt attack.
The scion casts *Command* (level 2 version), using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. The scion can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 11, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. *Failure:* 7 (or [[2d6]] (2d6)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of the dragon's next turn. *Success:* Half damage only.
The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.
While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.
The drow makes two attacks using Shortsword or Drow Hand Crossbow in any combination
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

The target makes a saving throw. *Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 15. *Failure:* The target has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. While Poisoned in this way, the target also has the Unconscious condition. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.
The drow casts *Darkness*, *Faerie Fire*, or *Levitate* (self only), requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12).
The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.
While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.
The drow makes three Abyssal Burst attacks.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks): At Will: Dancing Lights, Mage Armor (included in AC), Mage Hand, Minor Illusion 1/Day: Summon Fiend (demon only)
The drow casts *Faerie Fire* or *Misty Step*, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.
While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

The target makes a saving throw. *Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 12. *Failure:* The target has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it also has the Unconscious condition while Poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11): At Will: Dancing Lights 1/Day: Faerie Fire
The wonder can carry up to 100 pounds.

The wonder has the Unconscious condition until another creature winds it with the wonder's unique key for 1 minute. Once wound, the wonder operates for 24 hours or until a creature touches the wonder with its key as a Utilize action to deactivate it, after which the wonder has the Unconscious condition until it is wound again.

The wonder chirps a merry, metronomic tune. The wonder chooses one ally that it can see within 60 feet. Until the start of the wonder's next turn, the target has Advantage on the next ability check it makes with a Musical Instrument or Tinker's Tools.
The wonder takes the Dash action.

If Karas is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Karas instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the save and only half damage if she fails. She can't use this trait if she has the Incapacitated condition.
If Karas fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.
Karas makes two attacks using Dread Dagger or Tyrant's Blade in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Hit or Miss:* The dagger magically returns to Karas's hand immediately after a ranged attack.
The target has the Frightened condition until the start of Karas's next turn. If the target is already Frightened, it instead takes 10 (or [[3d6]] (3d6)) Psychic damage.

Karas casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks): At Will: Friends, Silence, Thaumaturgy 2/Day: Ray of Sickness (level 5 version) 1/Day: Blight, Mislead
Karas moves up to half her Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and takes the Hide action.
The karas chembryl can take 3 legendary actions.

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 15, one creature Karas can see within 90 feet of herself. *Failure:* 10 (or [[3d6]] (3d6)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition for 1 minute. While Frightened, the target's Speed is 0 feet, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. *Failure or Success:* Karas can't take this action again until the start of her next turn.
Karas makes one Dread Dagger attack and uses Withdraw.
Manshoon has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Manshoon makes three Arcane Burst attacks. He can replace two attacks with a use of Spellcasting.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Manshoon casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19): At Will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Light, Lightning Bolt (level 4 version), Mage Armor (included in AC), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation 2/Day Each: Scrying, Sending, Wall of Force 1/Day Each: Befuddlement, Clone, Finger of Death, Mind Blank (cast before combat), Simulacrum
Manshoon casts *Counterspell* or *Shield* in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
Manshoon casts *Misty Step*, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

languages.custom: Understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

description.value: If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.
The nimblewright makes three attacks, using Scimitar or Clockwork Crossbow in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Trigger:* The nimblewright is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. *Response:* The nimblewright adds 2 to its AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

languages.custom: Understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

description.value: If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.
The nimblewright has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The nimblewright makes four attacks, using Halting Slam or Radiant Ray in any combination.
The target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

languages.custom: Understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

description.value: If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

If the nimblewright moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 4 (or [[1d8]] (1d8)) Bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, has the Prone condition.
The nimblewright takes the Disengage action.

languages.custom: Understands Common and Deep Speech but can't speak; telepathy 120 ft.

description.value: The phaerimm has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The phaerimm makes three attacks, using Dread Stinger or Mindwarp Ray in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target has the Charmed condition until the start of the phaerimm's next turn.

The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15): At Will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand 1/Day Each: Clairvoyance, Major Image, Synaptic Static
The phaerimm casts *Counterspell* or *Shield* in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
The phaerimm teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

languages.custom: Understands Common and Deep Speech but can't speak; telepathy 30 ft.

description.value: The phaerimm has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The phaerimm makes two Stinger attacks.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At Will: Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand
The serpent can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.
The serpent makes one Bite attack and uses Constrict.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Strength Saving Throw:* DC 14, one Medium or smaller creature the snake can see within 10 feet. *Failure:* 3 (or [[1d6]] (1d6)) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (or [[2d6]] (2d6)) Cold damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.
Creatures of Forfallen's choice (excluding herself) in a 30-foot Emanation originating from her have Advantage on attack rolls. She can't use this trait if she has the Incapacitated condition.
Forfallen has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Forfallen makes three attacks, using Greataxe or Handaxe in any combination.
The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 16, one creature Forfallen can see within 20 feet. The target has Disadvantage on this save if it has the Poisoned condition. *First Failure:* The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it's still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. *Second Failure:* The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition, becoming a statue of rusted iron.
The Rusted makes three attacks, using Slam or Rusted Shot Put in any combination.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

*Trigger:* The Rusted is hit by an attack roll that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage. *Response—Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 16, each creature of the Rusted's choice in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the Rusted. *Failure:* the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the target's next turn.
The Rusted makes two attacks, using Greatsword or Javelin in any combination.
The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.
The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.
The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.
If the Rusted fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
The Rusted makes two Bite attacks.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Dexterity Saving Throw:* DC 19, each creature and flammable object that isn't being worn or carried in a 60-foot Cone. *Failure:* 45 (or [[7d12]] (7d12)) Fire damage, and the target starts burning. *Success:* Half damage only. *Failure or Success:* Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 19, one creature within 20 feet of the Rusted. *Failure:* 14 (or [[4d6]] (4d6)) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target has the Paralyzed condition.
If Sammaster fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
Creatures within 60 feet of Sammaster can't regain Hit Points.
Sammaster has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Sammaster has a magical soul gem as his dracolich heart. The gem can't be damaged or removed until he is reduced to 0 Hit Points. If Sammaster is reduced to 0 Hit Points, his dracolich form dissolves to dust. After [[1d10]] (1d10) days, he appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of his soul gem (so long as the gem still exists), using the Sammaster (Lich Form) stat block. The gem is a Tiny object that has AC 20; HP 50; and Immunity to Acid, Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The gem regains all its Hit Points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points.
Sammaster makes three Rend attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast *Blight* or *Ray of Sickness* (level 6 version).
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 20, each creature in a 90-foot Cone. *Failure:* 52 (or [[8d12]] (8d12)) Acid or Necrotic damage (Sammaster's choice). *Success:* Half damage.

Sammaster casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks): At Will: Blight, Detect Magic, Dispel Magic, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Ray of Sickness (level 6 version) 2/Day Each: Dimension Door, Speak with Dead 1/Day Each: Create Undead (level 8 version), Power Word Kill
The sammaster - dracolich form can take 3 legendary actions.
Sammaster moves up to half his Speed, and he makes one Rend attack.
Sammaster uses Spellcasting to cast *Ray of Sickness* (level 6 version).

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 21, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from Sammaster. *Failure:* 13 (or [[2d12]] (2d12)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. *Failure or Success:* Sammaster can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.
If Sammaster fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
Creatures within 60 feet of Sammaster can't regain Hit Points.
Sammaster has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

If Sammaster is reduced to 0 Hit Points while his magical soul gem exists, his lich form dissolves to dust. After [[1d10]] (1d10) days, he appears in the space of his soul gem, using the **Sammaster (Dracolich Form)** stat block. The gem is a Tiny object that has AC 20; HP 50; and Immunity to Acid, Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The gem regains all its Hit Points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points. If the gem is destroyed, Sammaster can create a new one by completing an 8-hour ritual using a gem worth 1,000+ GP, which the ritual consumes, and by expending 5,000 GP.
Sammaster makes three attacks, using Corrosive Burst or Paralyzing Touch in any combination. He can replace two attacks with a use of Spellcasting.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of Sammaster's next turn.

Sammaster casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21): At Will: Cone of Cold, Detect Magic, Dispel Magic, Invisibility, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation 2/Day Each: Speak with Dead, Wall of Force 1/Day Each: Create Undead (level 8 version), Disintegrate, Power Word Kill
Sammaster casts *Counterspell* or *Shield* in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
The sammaster - lich form can take 3 legendary actions.
Sammaster teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see, and each creature within 10 feet of the space he left takes 19 (or [[3d12]] (3d12)) Necrotic damage.
Sammaster makes one Corrosive Burst attack.

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 21, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from Sammaster. *Failure:* 13 (or [[2d12]] (2d12)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. *Failure or Success:* Sammaster can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. *Failure:* 13 (or [[3d8]] (3d8)) Necrotic damage. *Success:* Half damage.

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 12, each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a 15-foot Cone. *Failure:* The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
When the spore is subjected to Fire damage, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the spore takes 7 (or [[2d6]] (2d6)) Fire damage.
The spore doesn't need to expend extra movement to move through Difficult Terrain.
The spore makes four Tendril attacks. Alternatively, it makes two Tendril attacks and uses Consume once.
If the target is Large or smaller, the spore pulls the target 5 feet straight toward itself.

*Strength Saving Throw:* DC 18, one Large or smaller creature within 5 feet. *Failure:* The target is pulled into the spore's space and has the Grappled condition (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, the target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, and it takes 17 (or [[5d6]] (5d6)) Acid damage at the start of each of the spore's turns. When the spore moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The spore can have one Large creature or up to nine Medium or smaller creatures Grappled at a time.
The swanmay doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
The swanmay makes two attacks, using Beak, Longbow, or Scimitar in any combination.
If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

The swanmay casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): At Will: Druidcraft, Speak with Animals (swan form only) 1/Day Each: Animal Friendship, Beast Sense, Spike Growth

The swanmay shape-shifts into a Small swan, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.
If Valindra fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.
If destroyed, Valindra re-forms in [[1d10]] (1d10) days if her spirit gem is intact, reviving with all her Hit Points. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within her lair.
Valindra makes three attacks, using Eldritch Burst or Paralyzing Touch in any combination. She can replace two attacks with a use of Spellcasting to cast *Lightning Bolt* (level 5 version).
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of Valindra's next turn.

*Dexterity Saving Throw:* DC 20, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from Valindra. *First Failure:* 39 (or [[6d12]] (6d12)) Force damage and the target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. *Subsequent Failures:* 39 (or [[6d12]] (6d12)) Necrotic damage, and Valindra gains 20 Temporary Hit Points.

Valindra casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20): At Will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic, Fly, Invisibility, Lightning Bolt (level 5 version), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation 2/Day Each: Animate Dead, Plane Shift 1/Day Each: Cone of Cold (level 8 version), Finger of Death, Power Word Kill, Scrying
Valindra casts *Counterspell* or *Shield* in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Valindra casts *Disguise Self*, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. The spell lasts until Valindra drops to 30 Hit Points or fewer or uses her Life-Rending Gaze Legendary Action. Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to discern her true appearance are made with Disadvantage.
The valindra shadowmantle can take 3 legendary actions.

*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 20, each creature that isn't Undead in a 20-foot Emanation originating from Valindra. *Failure:* 21 (or [[6d6]] (6d6)) Necrotic damage. *Success:* Half damage. *Failure or Success:* Valindra can't take this action again until the start of her next turn.
Valindra makes one Eldritch Burst attack. Before or after the attack, Valindra can teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 20, one creature Valindra can see within 30 feet. *Failure:* 22 (or [[4d10]] (4d10)) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. *Success:* Half damage only.

languages.custom: Common, Draconic (can't speak in wyvern form)

description.value: The werewyvern doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
The werewyvern makes three attacks, using Javelin or Rend in any combination. It can replace one of these attacks with one Stinger attack.

items.name: Javelin (Melee, Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)

description.value: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

items.name: Javelin (Ranged, Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)

description.value: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the werewyvern's next turn. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. *Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 16. *Failure:* The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a **Werewyvern** under the DM's control and has 20 Hit Points. *Success:* The target is immune to this werewyvern's curse for 24 hours.

The werewyvern shape-shifts into a Medium wyvern-humanoid hybrid or a Large wyvern, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.
The dragon makes three Rend attacks.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 14, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. *Failure:* 22 (or [[4d10]] (4d10)) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of the dragon's next turn. *Success:* Half damage only.
The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Time-Warping Breath.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
*Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. *Failure:* 36 (or [[8d8]] (8d8)) Necrotic damage. *Success:* Half damage.

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 15, each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a 30-foot Cone. *Failure:* The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.
Creatures in a 10-foot Emanation originating from the Zhentilar have their Speeds halved while in the Emanation. The Zhentilar can designate creatures to be unaffected by the aura.
The Zhentilar makes three attacks, using Dooming Blade or Oppressive Ray in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The Zhentilar casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): 1/Day Each: Command, Fear
The Zhentilar makes two attacks, using Shortsword or Pistol in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Knock Down.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

*Strength Saving Throw:* DC 12, one creature within 5 feet that the Zhentilar can see. *Failure:* 4 (or [[1d4 + 2]] (1d4 + 2)) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.
Zlan senses the emotions of anyone touching a piece of chardalyn within 100 miles of itself.
If Zlan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
Zlan has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

If Zlan dies within 100 miles of a piece of chardalyn at least 4 inches long, it re-forms from that piece of chardalyn in [[1d10]] (1d10) days, regaining all its Hit Points. The new body appears in the unoccupied space nearest to the piece of chardalyn, and another lich's mind in the body seizes psychic control of the body.
Zlan makes three attacks, using Slam or Bewildering Bolt in any combination. It can replace two attacks with a use of Spellcasting.
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].
The target has the Charmed condition until the end of its next turn.

Zlan casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19): At Will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic, Mage Hand, Message 2/Day Each: Dimension Door, Fly, Scrying 1/Day Each: Befuddlement, Disintegrate
Zlan casts *Counterspell* in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
The zlan can take 3 legendary actions.
Zlan makes one Slam or Bewildering Bolt attack.

*Wisdom Saving Throw:* DC 19, one creature Zlan can see within 30 feet (with Disadvantage if the target is holding or wearing chardalyn). *Failure:* 27 (or [[6d8]] (6d8)) Psychic damage and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 minute or until Zlan dies. While Charmed, the target doesn't act as an ally to any creature. *Success:* Half damage only. *Failure or Success:* Zlan can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.
